result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer K Lyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.
6/09/16 - restitution amount amended.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

from DOC Financial Program Supervisor Jade Alegre questions DNA surcharge.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing purposes. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Not to write any checks while matter is pending.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon appeared by video conference. Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews issuance of warrants. State requests forfeiture of all bonds already posted, requests new bonds on all cases. Court will not forfeit bond, adds $1,000 to whatever amount bond is currently set at. All other conditions remain in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon not in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 2:48 pm, reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer's office spoke to defendant earlier today, had expected her to be here to wrap all matter up. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to write any checks while matter is pending.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from Atty Schaefer requesting to reschedule 4/18/16 IA because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2016 at 11:15 am.
